<RESUME_START>
BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT CONSULTANT
Career Focus
Self starter, customer focused and detail oriented business professional with multiple industry business development experience complemented by staffing industry, and Human Resources experience, specializing in business implementation and recruiting.
Proven track record of consistently exceeding corporate objectives and quotas.
Highly articulate and persuasive communicator able to reach individuals and groups from all organizational levels.
Ability to liaison between clients, Human Resources, sales and management.
Strong writing, editing, and presentation skills.
Extensive background in Networking, Building Customer Relations, Presentation, Sales & Marketing, Follow up, and Project Coordination.
Highly skilled strategic thinker, able to plan and implement client orientation program that achieve organizational objectives and business development goals.
Summary of Skills
Microsoft Office Programs, SharePoint, PeopleSoft, ADP Payroll, and Internet applications and Research.

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Human Resources
· Reduced employee turnover by 10% in one year.
Sales & Marketing
· Increased Accessory
World's revenue by 25% in less than 3 months.
Recruiting
· Developed recruiting plans, marketed, and hosted job fairs, which filled 120
hard to fill Building Inspector and Plans Examiner vacancies for The City of Houston's Permitting Center in
a period of six months, by sourcing and recruiting nationwide.
Business Development
· Promoted
to the largest territory for Workforce
Solutions, post exceeding market share and customer loyalty annual goals, in just over the first quarter of
the year in the second largest territory for the organization.
Business Management
· Implemented an attendance disclaimer, which
significantly decreased hiring event cancellations in current Workforce
Solutions Center.
Employee Engagement
· Earned 2nd highest fill rate in the
region for Workforce Solutions, by
improving quality of job postings, and actively encouraging Employment
Counselor and Staffing Specialist teams in aggressive recruitment efforts.

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

<JD_START>
Job Title: Business Development Manager

Location: Humble, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Our client, a leading product manufacturing company based in North Houston, is seeking a dynamic and driven Sales Representative specializing in Territory Management with 4-8 years of experience in business-to-business sales. This role is tailored for a sales hunter, someone who is adept at identifying, pursuing, and capturing new sales opportunities within designated territories and expanding our business reach.Key Responsibilities:1. Lead Generation and Prospecting: Actively identify potential clients within the territory. Utilize innovative strategies to generate new leads and build a strong sales pipeline.2. Client Relationship Management: Forge and maintain robust relationships with business clients within the territory. Understand their unique needs and offer customized solutions that align with our product offerings.3. Sales Strategy Development: Collaborate with the sales team to create effective, territory-specific sales strategies targeting key markets and customer segments.4. Territory Management: Develop and execute a strategic plan to manage and grow sales within a designated territory. Regularly analyze territorial market trends and customer needs to optimize sales strategies.5. Product Knowledge: Acquire comprehensive knowledge of our product range to effectively communicate benefits and features to potential clients.6. Negotiation and Closing: Employ skillful negotiation tactics to finalize contracts and close deals, ensuring profitable and mutually beneficial outcomes.7. Market Analysis: Continuously monitor and analyze market trends, competitor activities, and customer feedback within the territory to identify new sales opportunities and potential areas of expansion.8. Sales Targets and Reporting: Achieve and surpass set sales targets within the territory. Provide detailed feedback and regular reports on customer interactions, sales progress, and market conditions.Qualifications:· Proven success in business to business sales and territory management with 4-8 years of experience.· Strong hunter mentality, adept at identifying, pursuing, and capturing new sales opportunities.· Exceptional communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.· Capability to work autonomously and collaboratively.· Familiarity with the manufacturing sector is advantageous.· Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field preferred.. Open to travelWhat We Offer:· Competitive salary and performance-based commission.· Professional development and growth opportunities.· Collaborative team environment.· Comprehensive health benefits.· 401(k) retirement plan.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
